documentation:
Amazon WorkSpaces Service

Amazon WorkSpaces enables you to provision virtual, cloud-based Microsoft Windows desktops for your users.

DescribeWorkspaceDirectories.name: DescribeWorkspaceDirectories

DirectoryIds.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>The identifiers of the directories. If the value is null, all directories are retrieved.</simpara>
DirectoryIds.documentation: The identifiers of the directories. If the value is null, all directories are retrieved.

NextToken.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>The token for the next set of results. (You received this token from a previous call.)</simpara>
NextToken.documentation: The token for the next set of results. (You received this token from a previous call.)

RegistrationCode.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>The registration code for the directory. This is the code that users enter in their Amazon WorkSpaces client application to connect to the directory.</simpara>
RegistrationCode.documentation: The registration code for the directory. This is the code that users enter in their Amazon WorkSpaces client application to connect to the directory.

SubnetIds.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>The identifiers of the subnets used with the directory.</simpara>

CustomerUserName.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>The user name for the service account.</simpara>

IamRoleId.documentation: The identifier of the IAM role. This is the role that allows Amazon WorkSpaces to make calls to other services, such as Amazon EC2, on your behalf.

WorkspaceSecurityGroupId.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>The identifier of the security group that is assigned to new WorkSpaces.</simpara>

State.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>The state of the directory's registration with Amazon WorkSpaces</simpara>
State.documentation: The state of the directory's registration with Amazon WorkSpaces

EnableWorkDocs.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>Indicates whether the directory is enabled for Amazon WorkDocs.</simpara>
EnableWorkDocs.documentation: Indicates whether the directory is enabled for Amazon WorkDocs.

EnableInternetAccess.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>The public IP address to attach to all WorkSpaces that are created or rebuilt.</simpara>
EnableInternetAccess.documentation: The public IP address to attach to all WorkSpaces that are created or rebuilt.

DefaultOu.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>The organizational unit (OU) in the directory for the WorkSpace machine accounts.</simpara>
DefaultOu.documentation: The organizational unit (OU) in the directory for the WorkSpace machine accounts.

CustomSecurityGroupId.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>The identifier of any security groups to apply to WorkSpaces when they are created.</simpara>

UserEnabledAsLocalAdministrator.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>Indicates whether the WorkSpace user is an administrator on the WorkSpace.</simpara>
UserEnabledAsLocalAdministrator.documentation: Indicates whether the WorkSpace user is an administrator on the WorkSpace.

WorkspaceCreationProperties.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>The default creation properties for all WorkSpaces in the directory.</simpara>

ipGroupIds.zonbookDocumentation: <para>The identifiers of the IP access control groups associated with the directory.</para>

Owner.zonbookDocumentation: The owner of the bundles. This parameter cannot be combined with any other filter. Specify AMAZON to describe the bundles provided by AWS or null to describe the bundles that belong to your account.

The owner of the bundles. This parameter cannot be combined with any other filter.

DescribeWorkspaceBundles.documentation:
Describes the available WorkSpace bundles.

You can filter the results using either bundle ID or owner, but not both.

DescribeWorkspaces.name: DescribeWorkspaces

WorkspaceIds.zonbookDocumentation:
<simpara>The IDs of the WorkSpaces. This parameter cannot be combined with any other filter.</simpara>
         <simpara>Because the <xref linkend="CreateWorkspaces"/> operation is asynchronous, the identifier it returns 
         is not immediately available. If you immediately call
         <xref linkend="DescribeWorkspaces"/> with this identifier, no information is returned.</simpara>
WorkspaceIds.documentation:
The IDs of the WorkSpaces. This parameter cannot be combined with any other filter.

Because the CreateWorkspaces operation is asynchronous, the identifier it returns is not immediately available. If you immediately call DescribeWorkspaces with this identifier, no information is returned.

DirectoryId.zonbookDocumentation: The ID of the directory. In addition, you can optionally specify a specific directory user (see UserName). This parameter cannot be combined with any other filter.
DirectoryId.documentation: The ID of the directory. In addition, you can optionally specify a specific directory user (see UserName). This parameter cannot be combined with any other filter.

UserName.zonbookDocumentation: The name of the directory user. You must specify this parameter with DirectoryId.
UserName.documentation: The name of the directory user. You must specify this parameter with DirectoryId.

BundleId.zonbookDocumentation:
<simpara>The ID of the bundle. All WorkSpaces that are created from this bundle are retrieved. 
         This parameter cannot be combined with any other filter.</simpara>
BundleId.documentation: The ID of the bundle. All WorkSpaces that are created from this bundle are retrieved. This parameter cannot be combined with any other filter.

Limit.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>The maximum number of items to return.</simpara>
Limit.documentation: The maximum number of items to return.

NextToken.documentation: The token for the next set of results. (You received this token from a previous call.)

         could be incomplete.</simpara>

Information about the WorkSpaces.

Because CreateWorkspaces is an asynchronous operation, some of the returned information could be incomplete.

DescribeWorkspaces.documentation:
Describes the specified WorkSpaces.

You can filter the results using bundle ID, directory ID, or owner, but you can specify only one filter at a time.

         information returned can be incomplete.</simpara>

CreateWorkspaces.documentation:
Creates one or more WorkSpaces.

This operation is asynchronous and returns before the WorkSpaces are created.

TerminateWorkspaces.name: TerminateWorkspaces

TerminateWorkspaceRequests.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>The WorkSpaces to terminate. You can specify up to 25 WorkSpaces.</simpara>
TerminateWorkspaceRequests.documentation: The WorkSpaces to terminate. You can specify up to 25 WorkSpaces.

FailedRequests.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>Information about the WorkSpaces that could not be terminated.</simpara>
FailedRequests.documentation: Information about the WorkSpaces that could not be terminated.

members.zonbookDocumentation:
<simpara>Information about a WorkSpace that could not be rebooted
         (<xref linkend="RebootWorkspaces"/>), rebuilt (<xref linkend="RebuildWorkspaces"/>), terminated
         (<xref linkend="TerminateWorkspaces"/>), started (<xref linkend="StartWorkspaces"/>), or stopped (<xref linkend="StopWorkspaces"/>).</simpara>
members.documentation: Information about a WorkSpace that could not be rebooted (RebootWorkspaces), rebuilt (RebuildWorkspaces), terminated (TerminateWorkspaces), started (StartWorkspaces), or stopped (StopWorkspaces).

TerminateWorkspaces.documentation:
Terminates the specified WorkSpaces.

Terminating a WorkSpace is a permanent action and cannot be undone. The user's data is destroyed. If you need to archive any user data, contact Amazon Web Services before terminating the WorkSpace.

You can terminate a WorkSpace that is in any state except SUSPENDED.

This operation is asynchronous and returns before the WorkSpaces have been completely terminated.

RebootWorkspaces.name: RebootWorkspaces

RebootWorkspaceRequests.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>The WorkSpaces to reboot. You can specify up to 25 WorkSpaces.</simpara>
RebootWorkspaceRequests.documentation: The WorkSpaces to reboot. You can specify up to 25 WorkSpaces.

FailedRequests.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>Information about the WorkSpaces that could not be rebooted.</simpara>
FailedRequests.documentation: Information about the WorkSpaces that could not be rebooted.

members.zonbookDocumentation:
<simpara>Information about a WorkSpace that could not be rebooted
         (<xref linkend="RebootWorkspaces"/>), rebuilt (<xref linkend="RebuildWorkspaces"/>), terminated
         (<xref linkend="TerminateWorkspaces"/>), started (<xref linkend="StartWorkspaces"/>), or stopped (<xref linkend="StopWorkspaces"/>).</simpara>
members.documentation: Information about a WorkSpace that could not be rebooted (RebootWorkspaces), rebuilt (RebuildWorkspaces), terminated (TerminateWorkspaces), started (StartWorkspaces), or stopped (StopWorkspaces).

RebootWorkspaces.documentation:
Reboots the specified WorkSpaces.

You cannot reboot a WorkSpace unless its state is AVAILABLE or UNHEALTHY.

This operation is asynchronous and returns before the WorkSpaces have rebooted.

RebuildWorkspaces.name: RebuildWorkspaces

RebuildWorkspaceRequests.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>The WorkSpace to rebuild. You can specify a single WorkSpace.</simpara>
RebuildWorkspaceRequests.documentation: The WorkSpace to rebuild. You can specify a single WorkSpace.

FailedRequests.zonbookDocumentation: <simpara>Information about the WorkSpace if it could not be rebuilt.</simpara>
FailedRequests.documentation: Information about the WorkSpace if it could not be rebuilt.

members.zonbookDocumentation:
<simpara>Information about a WorkSpace that could not be rebooted
         (<xref linkend="RebootWorkspaces"/>), rebuilt (<xref linkend="RebuildWorkspaces"/>), terminated
         (<xref linkend="TerminateWorkspaces"/>), started (<xref linkend="StartWorkspaces"/>), or stopped (<xref linkend="StopWorkspaces"/>).</simpara>
members.documentation: Information about a WorkSpace that could not be rebooted (RebootWorkspaces), rebuilt (RebuildWorkspaces), terminated (TerminateWorkspaces), started (StartWorkspaces), or stopped (StopWorkspaces).

RebuildWorkspaces.documentation:
Rebuilds the specified WorkSpace.

You cannot rebuild a WorkSpace unless its state is AVAILABLE, ERROR, or UNHEALTHY.

Rebuilding a WorkSpace is a potentially destructive action that can result in the loss of data. For more information, see Rebuild a WorkSpace.

This operation is asynchronous and returns before the WorkSpaces have been completely rebuilt.

StartWorkspaces.documentation:
Starts the specified WorkSpaces.

You cannot start a WorkSpace unless it has a running mode of AutoStop and a state of STOPPED.

<simpara>Information about a WorkSpace that could not be rebooted

         (<xref linkend="TerminateWorkspaces"/>), started (<xref linkend="StartWorkspaces"/>), or stopped (<xref linkend="StopWorkspaces"/>).</simpara>
members.documentation: Information about a WorkSpace that could not be rebooted (RebootWorkspaces), rebuilt (RebuildWorkspaces), terminated (TerminateWorkspaces), started (StartWorkspaces), or stopped (StopWorkspaces).

StopWorkspaces.documentation:
Stops the specified WorkSpaces.

You cannot stop a WorkSpace unless it has a running mode of AutoStop and a state of AVAILABLE, IMPAIRED, UNHEALTHY, or ERROR.

ModifyWorkspaceState.documentation:
Sets the state of the specified WorkSpace.

To maintain a WorkSpace without being interrupted, set the WorkSpace state to ADMIN_MAINTENANCE. WorkSpaces in this state do not respond to requests to reboot, stop, start, or rebuild. An AutoStop WorkSpace in this state is not stopped. Users can log into a WorkSpace in the ADMIN_MAINTENANCE state.

CreateIpGroup.documentation:
Creates an IP access control group.

An IP access control group provides you with the ability to control the IP addresses from which users are allowed to access their WorkSpaces. To specify the CIDR address ranges, add rules to your IP access control group and then associate the group with your directory. You can add rules when you create the group or at any time using AuthorizeIpRules.

There is a default IP access control group associated with your directory. If you don't associate an IP access control group with your directory, the default group is used. The default group includes a default rule that allows users to access their WorkSpaces from anywhere. You cannot modify the default IP access control group for your directory.

AuthorizeIpRules.documentation:
Adds one or more rules to the specified IP access control group.

This action gives users permission to access their WorkSpaces from the CIDR address ranges specified in the rules.
